meanings.definition: To surpass in fencing or enclosing.
meanings.sent1: The skilled fencer easily outfences his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The farmer outfences his land to protect his crops from animals.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outfences the cat by climbing a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win outfences any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The knight's ability to outfences the dragon was legendary.

meanings.definition: To enclose or surround with a fence or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The new neighborhood outfences a beautiful park.
meanings.sent2: The zoo outfences the area to keep the animals safe.
meanings.sent3: The children play a game where they try to outfences each other in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The fortress outfences the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent5: The garden outfences a variety of colorful flowers.
